column1: One day when little George was seven years old his father set out by coach to visit another son
column2: who was in the service of the Duke of Saxe-Weissenfels. The little boy begged his father to let him go on the journey. "No
column3: he replied, you are too young to go so far."However
column4: when the coach set out George Frederick set out too on foot to follow
column5: and he would not be sent home again.He kept on trudging along as fast as his little feet would go. Everyone hoped he would get tired and go back
column6: but finally the father had to order the coach to stop and take him in. Thus
column7: did he show that determination which helped him all his life.Arrived at the castle the boy soon made friends with the chapel musicians. They took him to the organ loft
column8: where he played for them.All were delighted with his talent. One day the Duke himself heard him play. He
column10: was astonished that one so young should show so much skill. Calling the father into his presence
column11: he pointed out how wrong it was to deny the boy the right to study music.
